solution_line_template: It cost {initial_cost}*{daily_cost_percent}=${<<{initial_cost}*{daily_cost_percent}={daily_running_cost}>>{daily_running_cost}} a day to keep the place open
He makes {tickets_per_day}*{price_per_ticket}=${<<{tickets_per_day}*{price_per_ticket}={daily_revenue}>>{daily_revenue}} a day from the park
So he makes a profit of {daily_revenue}-{daily_running_cost}=${<<{daily_revenue}-{daily_running_cost}={daily_profit}>>{daily_profit}} a day
So it takes {initial_cost}/{daily_profit}=<<{initial_cost}/{daily_profit}={days_to_break_even}>>{days_to_break_even} days to make back his money
